sentences.en: A degree is more of a hindrance than a help in British industry.
sentences.cn: 在英国工业界，学位反倒是个累赘。

sentences.en: An individual may express any views at all without legal hindrance.
sentences.cn: 个人可以不受法律约束地表达任何观点.

sentences.en: Electrode effects, which are always a hindrance when the Dipole - Dipole array is used.
sentences.cn: 电极效应在用偶极 - 偶极排列时是经常遇到的一种干扰因素.

sentences.en: Lack of experience does not constitute a major hindrance to progress.
sentences.cn: 经验缺乏并不是进步的主要障碍.

sentences.en: Macromolecules cannot approach the ligand owing to steric hindrance of the matrix.
sentences.cn: 由于载体的立体位阻的关系,大分子化合物不能接触到配基.

sentences.en: Now they can construct tunnel systems without hindrance.
sentences.cn: 现在他们可以顺利地建造隧道系统了.

sentences.en: Of course, the small hands were really a hindrance.
sentences.cn: 当然, 那双小手实际上是父母的累赘.

sentences.en: Please allow the bearer of this passport to pass freely without let or hindrance.
sentences.cn: 请予护照持有人顺利通行.

sentences.en: Strong winds are a hindrance to mountain climbers.
sentences.cn: 大风对登山者是一大妨碍.

sentences.en: Such aids may be just more a hindrance a help.
sentences.cn: 这样的援助可能完全是帮倒忙.

sentences.en: The heavy baggage was a great hindrance to me.
sentences.cn: 那件行李成了我的大累赘.

sentences.en: The pitiful condition of their workshop became more of hindrance than ever.
sentences.cn: 本来就够凄凉可怜的工作间,比以前更成问题了.

sentences.en: The servants were more of a hindrance than a help ( to me ).
sentences.cn: 这些用人 ( 对我来说 ) 帮不上忙反而是累赘.

sentences.en: They boarded their flight to Paris without hindrance.
sentences.cn: 他们顺利地登上了飞往巴黎的航班。

sentences.en: To be honest, she was more of a hindrance than a help.
sentences.cn: 说实在的，她没帮上忙，反而成了累赘。

sentences.en: With a lifetime before her, the length of books was no hindrance.
sentences.cn: 她的有生之年尚多, 长篇累牍并无妨害.

words.tran_cn: 障碍；妨碍；妨害；[化学]阻碍物

trans.tran_cn: 阻碍，妨碍，障碍物，起妨碍作用的人
trans.tran_en: something or someone that makes it difficult for you to do something
